Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5* hotel...perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PaulDM1986
Reviews.Content: Can say nothing other than superb!!! its a definite 5* boutique hotel in all areas. All the staff are very friendly and cant do enough for you. We stayed in a junior suite which was amazing...very clean and modern, enormous bed, even bigger bathroom, rainforest shower, free wi-fi, nice and quiet what else could you ask for. The interior of the hotel is very well decorated...the lift itself is a reason to stay!!! your located just of the champs elysee 5 minutes from arc de triumphe and all other attractions are easily accessible. If your after a stay in paris, with central location, and after a spot of luxury then i recommend this hotel...thank you for an enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Springtime a Paris”
Reviews.Author: mbpolo
Reviews.Content: Am I lucky or what !!! Amazing from start to finish . Great location 5 minute walk to Champs Elysees. some might think this is the wrong side ... well keep it our secret. Innner courtyard room ... windows open all night ..NO NOISE ... bed , mattress and sheets would not fit in our suitcase ...slept like babies . Shower like a downpour and giant bath ... Staff very attentive , very polite, and always smiling ... cannot recommend enough TOP.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Wendy381
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a junior suite. The room was immaculate and smelled gorgeous. The bed was super comfy. The house keeping kept everything immaculate I was very happy with our room and extremely happy with the the staff who did everything possible to help in any way, even when i was getting ready to see the moulin rouge show and realised I had forgotten my favourite red lipstick. I rang reception and one of the staff went on a mission to find me a red lipstick, which she did! A must for the Moulin rouge show! They also went out of their way to source my husbands favourite T-bags ( normally he takes some with him) now that's what I call service.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance”
Reviews.Author: rwist
Reviews.Content: The Champs Elysees Plaza Hotel provides a welcome respite from the crowds and noise experienced by the typical Paris pedestrian. The staff was very helpful. It was 33C on the day we arrived and the air conditioner leaked - a call to the front desk and the staff was there in ten minutes to fix it. The junior suite was nicely decorated and the bed was excellent. The room was immaculate from a cleanliness standpoint. The small bar is a great place to conduct business and the restaurant was an enjoyable place to enjoy breakfast. We will definitely return again on our next visit to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Paris new years 2011”
Reviews.Author: steven c
Reviews.Content: If you want to endulge this is the place. Service is spectacular and the location is central to everything. Great small hotel with character

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: PM4
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't really be faulted. The service is gracious and discreet. The rooms (we had a junior suite) were beautifully decorated and maintained to a high standard. The bar and dining room were comfortable and very welcoming. Good location, quiet, small and a real gem in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michski81
Reviews.Content: Junior suite was lovely, jacuzzi bath was just perfect after a day of pavement pounding in Paris. One let down was the quality of the room service food. It was average but NOT average price. €28 for a plain chicken breast with no sides or anything!

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rob H
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Paris with my girlfriend where we stayed at the Champs Elysees Plaza... We had the best time in the most beautiful city and it wouldn't have been the same if we had stayed anywhere else... perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Great nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: slely
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 16/10/11 in a junior suite to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. Our requirements were a quiet hotel, minimum of a kingsize bed and a bath. To get this in Paris you do have to pay a premium. Our junior suite met all our requirements well and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. My only niggle would be that this is the only I've ever stayed in that charges you minibar prices for coffee you make yourself in your room! A lovely nespresso machine is provided, but bring your own coffee capsules, or buy them from the impressive nespresso boutique.

Reviews.Title: “Paris at its best”
Reviews.Author: theglobetrotter55
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel on a regular basis since 2004 as it is close to wirk and the champs elyseer... I have watched it transform from a beautiful but outdated hotel into a stylish and modern design place with some interesting touches from the past elegance. I love to stay either in the penthouse rooms from which you can see le Sacre Cour of montmatre or la tour effeil or in the corner rooms with three big windows on the street. The decorations of the rooms are very chic, each room has a marble mantelpiece and a huge mirror, very dramatic curtains and overall very unique atmosphere. Staff is caring and professional. Bar is nice. Menu of the restaurant could be improved. For me coming here is always an excellent experience as I feel so welcome and pampered. Now with spa... It is just perfect

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Parisienne Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Gaylehen
Reviews.Content: A unique hotel in a great location, only 200m to the closest Metro station. The rooms are beautifully decorated and everything you would want a French hotel to be but without the cost of a five star hotel. The staff are very friendly and accommadating, they made our stay in Paris a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail and service does matter”
Reviews.Author: skanklor1
Reviews.Content: An open letter to the reservation department and Amina, who really earned the "excellent" rating on behalf of CEP. Dear Amina, Just wanted to write to let you know about our experience at the Champs Elysee Plaza (CEP, for short). First off, thnx for changing our room for us. I know that having a removable shower head may be a small thing for people, but it was very important for my wife. Your attention to this detail when we checked in was exemplary. This pretty much set up the whole trip for us- it was tantamount to hitting a home run in terms of service. All of your staff were kind, courteous and pleasant. Breakfast was the best meal of the day, and I must have had 15 servings of yoghurt over our stay- that stuff is addictive! Internet worked without a hitch and there were no problems with any of the equipment in our room. Turn down chocolate was excellent and the home made caramel was great. We had requested some more, but I guess you ran out as we didn’t end up getting any after the first night. (This stuff was so good, that my wife would eat it instead of desert at the restaurants- or, alternatively, order desert, not eat that, and eat the chocolate instead.) A couple of minor points: -it seemed that there was an odor coming from the shower stall at certain times during the day- I assume that this was because of the sewers and it wasn’t that bad- the natural fragrance helped -would have liked a little more attention to cleaning the bathroom and Jacuzzi- but no real complaints, just that we had expected it to be spotless (it was still very clean though) -walls are a bit thin, could hear people walking around in the room above us, maybe more soundproofing would be preferable if it is possible. I know that CEP is a different type of hotel (more boutique than anything else) so keeping that in mind, I thought we had a very pleasant stay. However, although everyone was pleasant and helpful, my view was that it would have averaged about a four star stay given our experience at other places. That being said, I would rate this a five star b/c that extra help in getting us the room with the detachable shower head is worth an extra star in my opinion. Accordingly, plz pass along to your management that it was b/c of your efforts that our stay was so memorable and, if it hadn’t been for you coming out to meet us and helping us with the room change, it would have merely been an above average stay. Believe me when I say this, in that because of the level of service to which we are accustomed, the very little/minor things really do count and set certain establishments apart from others. In this case, I am really happy to say that it was your assistance that really made this trip memorable. Thnx again.

Reviews.Title: “Champs Elysees delight!”
Reviews.Author: lizard126
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel located on a quaint quiet rue off Champs Elysees. Quiet yet elegant and sexy. Rooms impeccably clean and comfy. The restaurant was delicious and the hotel staff knowledgeable and accommodating. Local grocery across the street and within walking distance of nightclubs, shopping, and amazing restaurants. Will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Nice and Central”
Reviews.Author: NeveragaininKavos
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late on a Friday evening, we were greeted professionally and given our room key promptly. The room was on the 6th Floor, it was tastefully decorated and spacious by Paris standards, there was a small lift suitable for two with case. Our stay was faultless throughout and I would recommend this hotel. It is not cheap but you get what you pay for. My only grumble would be if you use the tea or coffee facilities provided in the room you are charge €2 per tea bag or coffee capsule, where rooms are around €400 you would think a tea bag could be included! Staff always professional and helpful - we need to borrow umbrella's for 2 days of our trip but these where always in plentiful supply. It was nice to retreat back to the room after long days of sightseeing knowing it would always be spotless and comfortable - large bed, table and chairs for relaxing and watching the TV. I highly recommend their beds - 3 nights of great sleep. The maid that cleaned our room each day did a great job - always clean fluffy towels, plentiful toiletries. I would stay again in this hotel it is in a good central location, there is also a supermarket in the next road which was good for buying water and snacks for the room. George V is the nearest metro station but it’s only a ten minute walk from Charles de Gaulle – Étoile also.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel - we loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: gwsancaster
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in conjunction with two couples - one who has used the hotel many times and highly recommended it. We now share their enthusiasm. This boutique hotel is nicely located, with extremely well appointed rooms, great amenities and service that is outstanding. All staff we encountered over 3 days were very friendly, courteous, extremely service-oriented and made our stay exceptional. The breakfast is very good, and we had occasion to use the dining room for dinner on two occasions and found the food to be of exceptional quality and very good value. We highly recommend this hotel and we will use it next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend”
Reviews.Author: xminox
Reviews.Content: Everything in the hotel was perfect. People in the hotel were kind, cheerful and nice. Room was spacious, clean with the highest standard of comfort. Restaurant was also great, we enjoyed meal and also deserts. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Hotel, big rooms and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: abcturismo
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull Hotel, big rooms and great location!! Luxury 5 stars hotel, in the heart of Paris , a few steps from Champs Elysses. The rooms are renovated in a Classical Chic style, and are very big!!! Some rooms provide a splendid view of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Vessen
Reviews.Content: I was enjoy to stay a few days in Champs Elysees Plaza Hotel. Good staff, room, location, food.

Reviews.Title: “Made a very special trip even more special...”
Reviews.Author: Laurathepower
Reviews.Content: I recently retured from my stay with my partner at this hotel, it was my first trip to paris and i was stunned, in every aspect. My partner decided that he wanted to propose on the trip, and after the event he explained to me how helpful the hotel staff had been in all apsects of the preperation, Maud took care off all the car bookings, table reservations and all other communication that otherwise would have been nightmare for him to arrange, and they even went as far as making special changes in the room for our return to the hotel after his proposal. Yes the hotel is expensive, but anyone who expects to really enjoy paris on a shoestring is likely to be disappointed!!! The bed was so amazingly comfortable it was hard to get out of, despite parts of the hotel going through refurbishment we werent at any point aware of it, I can't fault any aspect of my visit, and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is the best quality-price ratio”
Reviews.Author: Jamilya_m
Reviews.Content: Hotel is the best we stayed in Paris. It was our 7th vacation in Paris and we tried over 17 Paris hotels as we usually stay 2-3 hotels in one visit. We liked 1. Location - in the centre few steps from Champs Elysee but in quite area, and for us and our baby night sleep is everything. 2. Hotel - very stylish, parisian and cosy atmosphere. Before I always looked in the windows of ancient houses and castles of Paris and wanted to see how it is inside, and with CEP i finally had a chance. 3. Rooms - very home style with big windows, beautiful curtains and new furniture. dvd player, plazma TV, tea/coffe maker, and 3 (!!!) pairs of slippers and 3 (!!!) bathrobes, etc. Bathroom is the biggest I experienced in Paris with separate toilet room, jakuzzi and separate shower. And the most important - CLEANNESS. Everything is clean. Bedclothes, carpet, chairs, etc. For us cleanness of room is the main point as we have a small child and kids easily catch infections and being sick with the baby is the worst what can happen when travelling. And the last but very important 4. Staff - professional from A to Z. We had a very quick check-in, personnel is very polite and any reasonable request was satisfied. May be someone can consider breakfast to be unvaried. But we appreciated best quality of food and its freshnes after being intoxicated in the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This elegant boutique hotel exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: cmarquis
Reviews.Content: My room, (#51) was spacious and beautifully decorated. As I was traveling with a friend and we were sharing the room, I was concerned that there would be adequate space for our clothes, etc. The room was huge by Paris standards, with a large, bathroom, shower and whirlpool bath. Sofa, fireplace, it really was a suite. The service was also exceptional, from the moment that I inquired about staying there. A lovely professional woman, Ibticem, responded to my inquiry as if she truly cared that I stay there. I wrote to several different hotels initially. There were roses and macarons in my room upon arrival with a note from the manager. Ibticem and her co-workers, an amazing team of pleasant professionals, happily booked all of our restaurants, cabs, etc. It seemed that we were asking for something constantly, and everyone was happy and pleasant. Location is perfect! I loved the atmosphere of the hotel, exclusive but never stiff or stuffy. The small, tasteful lounge was staffed with a charming and friendly bartender. The hotel is not inexpensive, but in my opinion, worth every penny! I also liked the fact that it wasn't full of Americans. I have found my Paris hotel, and plan to return in June, 2012. Cheryl Marquis Washington DC

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TrentDarwin
Reviews.Content: this hotel is one of the best i have ever stayed in. It has great facilities, in a great location and the staff where some of the best i have come across. The best part i found was the bed it is by far the best hotel bed i have ever slept in. The hotel has a great little cocktail bar which makes great cocktails and was a nice place to start a night out.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore this charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Dayna
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for our 2 night stay in Paris. We are so glad we found this place and when we visit Paris again, we will be staying in this beautiful boutique hotel. From the moment we arrived the staff could not do enough for us, more than helpful and very friendly. When i called reception from my room to enquire about the wifi connection, somebody was with us within 2 minutes and voila i was online. The junior suite we had was just stunning, a large bathroom with a jacuzzi bath perfect for relaxing in after walking the streets of Paris all day. Lovely decor, as it is throughout the hotel. The bar and restaurant are on the small side, but this just adds to the cosy atmosphere. A cosy and comfortable bar to enjoy a pre dinner glass of champagne. In a good location and steps away from the Champs Elysees. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonmeyer41
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a wonderful evening in the Junior Suite. Everything was of the best quality in the suite and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast was the best I have had. My only criticism is that we had to pay 7 euros for fried eggs and the coffee served in the lounge was 10 euros which I thought was extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrLove6
Reviews.Content: Start to finish, truly an exceptional boutique hotel. The prestige suite was large and beautifully furnished. Location was great, right off the Champs Elysees, and near the metro station, but just far enough from the hustle and bustle. Many great places to eat nearby. Staff was attentive but not overbearing and always very pleasant--they went out of their way to make our stay a pleasure. Every request was addressed immediately. If something wasnt perfect, they made sure to fix it. I wanted to try out my terrible French and they did humor me, but everyone on the staff spoke English well. My wife loved the Hermes bath products and the kids loved the Jacuzzi tub in our room and the steam room downstairs. We will definitely stay here again. Many other guests in the hotel seemed to be repeat customers as well, which speaks well for this gem in the 8th arrondisement.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bn05
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great location, a few minutes walk from the Champs-Elysees. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble and all spoke perfect English. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was beautifully furnished and incredibly spacious. Only slight criticism is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutqiue Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMP82
Reviews.Content: We arrived stayed at the hotel for 2 nights last week. In advance of our stay i contacted concierge and and requested help with a dinner reservation, which Clement dealt with in no time. (Incidentally the restaurant was also fantastic L'arome, definitely also worth a visit!) The hotel itself was fantastic, we had a junior suite which was a great sized bedroom, opulent, yet tastefully decorated and very comfortable indeed. The attached bathroom had a nice whirlpool bath and a fantastic rain drop shower, perfect to wake you up in the morning! The location of the hotel was great, just a 5 minute walk from the Champs Elysees. The service was also excellent. Very polite and helpful staff, eager to make your stay more enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this to others and will undoubtedly stay again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: THW_777
Reviews.Content: First class hotel from; STAFF, location, linens, soaps, or any additional need or desire you may have, oh and great nespresso in room. Great Chinese restaurant close by. The hotel is expensive but then it is Paris 1 block off of the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic paris visit”
Reviews.Author: 5530davidm
Reviews.Content: we travelled overnight by car from staffordshire uk with ferry crossing dover-dunkirk , arrived in paris with the rush hour in full flow. sally satnav took us directly to the champs elysees plaza hotel . our 4 night midweek break in august turned out to be a truly memorable trip the hotel is down a quiet side street about 400 metres off the famous champs elysees in central paris. we found the hotel small but very friendly the staff ( who all spoke fluent english ) were very friendly and most helpful giving advice , directions , help with car parking , every request was met with a polite, friendly and efficient response nothing was too much trouble and it was clear that excellent service was paramount . the hotel is furnished to a high standard and our room was a very good size with a very comfortable bed , bathroom was huge with the best shower ever and a jacuzzi bath to die for . room service was on the whole excellent , one time coffee arrived a little cool , but this was immediately put right . athough the hotel does not have a swimming pool the gym is of a good standard with sauna and steam room , complimentary fruit and mineral water supplied. paris is a great place to visit and the champs elysees plaza a superb place to stay we will be staying again in 2011 and would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Parisienne Delight!”
Reviews.Author: MattNett
Reviews.Content: Staff outstanding. Perfect or very good english skills. Attended to every request immediately - nice personal service. Recommended and booked excellent local restaurants for us. Drinks in the bar were served with sensational complementary canapes. In house dining also excellent. Decor funky/modern/luxe and very french. Gym well set up.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Dream”
Reviews.Author: Donna255108
Reviews.Content: We chose to have our wedding ceremony in a suite at the Plaza mainly because it was difficult to select and secure a suitable venue in Paris from NZ. The entire experience was fantastic, we were in France for a week before the wedding (staying in other accommodation) and visited the hotel to check on arrangements. The staff and management couldn't have been more helpful in assisting us with the wedding arrangements, they showed us the suite we would have the ceremony in and advised us on florists etc. We booked in the morning of the ceremony and again we received outstanding service and support. A major dress malfunction shortly before the ceremony was dealt with by an efficient housemaid and our every requirement was supported. We had a further two days at the hotel following the ceremony and the Plaza management and staff contributed to a once in a lifetime experience.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: miles28
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice. A bit pricy but quite worth it. Excellent location. Hot water was faulty-- fixed in an eye wink

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but terrible block”
Reviews.Author: quincy50
Reviews.Content: The hotel services (housekeeping, front desk, etc.) were excellent. The room was excellent. It was a large size, with an excellent mattress, linens, pillows.However there was no view. The bathroom was nicely tiled, and there was a jacuzzi tub. The sink lighting was not adequate. The shower was nice, but small. The lobby, bar, and restaurant were good. The major negative was the location. The block was ugly,busy, crowded, and this appearance extended several blocks in all directions. There was no Parisian charm. However, the Metro and Champs Elysees were close.

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever, if not even better”
Reviews.Author: Jeremyhs
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at this boutique hotel three times and will return again and again. the hotel is extremely difficult to fault but the ensuite bathroom lighting could be better but this is a very minor point. The hotel is superbly located within 500 metres of the Champs Elysees and many of the sights are within easy walking distance. The staff are very attentive and always ready to assist in any way, be it finding and booking a nearby restaurant or giving advice and organising trips to Versailles or Disneyland for example. It is expensive but you certainly get what you pay for - it would be good if you could get a light dinner in the restaurant, (presently only open for breakfast), but then there are so many bistro bars and restaurants nearby and there is the room service option. In all i have no hesitation in strongly recommeding this hotel and my wife and I are already looking forward to returning in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Très confortable”
Reviews.Author: casagrande2009
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome - Personnel very co-operatif and polite The room was clean, comfortable and cosy - bathroom big enough, with shower and Jacuzzi hydromassage Good breakfast with large choice of sweet and saulty food

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven....”
Reviews.Author: Holly11Wales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem. My husband actually bought the weekend on Ebay and having looked at various reviews we decided to go for it! I must admit, when we arrived I was a bit apprehensive as it's relatively small and unassuming but from the moment we checked in, everything was fine. The receptionist was friendly and helpful, our room was spacious and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was huge and toiletries gorgeous - great shower and bath. Flat screen tv with several english channels, wonderful bed and pillows and perfect, quiet air conditioning. Our only 'moan' was that there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room which had been advertised. When we rang reception, we were told they had none to spare but we could use room service instead free of charge. Not quite as convenient as making your own tea/coffee but within minutes of ordering our drinks arrived - very impressive. The location is superb. From the peacefulness of the hotel, within 5 minutes you're in the hustle and bustle of the champs elysees. We asked the receptionist to book a restaurant for us and he couldn't have been more helpful. His recommendation was fantastic and we had a fabulous dinner. Breakfast wasn't included so I can't comment as we walked to the champs elysees for coffee and croissants which were yummy! All in all, a very relaxing weekend - I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants the Paris buzz but to be able to go back to a hotel which is quiet and offers a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jangafett
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights here and had a fabulous stay. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly, helpful and informative. The rooms all looked beautifully presented from our junior suite to the bar and breakfast areas to the spa and gym, all without being stuffy and over-formal, something we appreciated. The reception staff booked a special meal for us at short notice but were equally as helpful when we looked for something closer to home later in the stay. We also used room service after a particularly long day's walking and this was good value for money and again well presented. We would definitely go back and hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location, will go back!”
Reviews.Author: bobby056
Reviews.Content: Where do I start! The location is amazing, a 4 minute walk from the Champs Elysees - which is where you want to be. I don't usually like boutique hotels, but I was so happy I went out of my comfort zone and booked this hotel for 4 nights. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were treated like royalty. Lovely staff, they speak English perfectly, but since my second language is French, I preferred to practice with them! Very polished service, and they made some wonderful suggestions for restaurants and even made the reservations. The housekeeping staff made up the room as soon as we left for the day, and the turndown service included some gourmet chocolates every night - and it was very much appreciated. We originally booked a regular room, since a 5 star was a bit of a splurge for us, but my husband was concerned about rooms size, so we e-mailed the hotel from Rome and upgraded to a suite. It was pricey, but I feel we got our money's worth and it was a special way to end our 4 week vacation in Europe. Room was nicely decorated, with a sound system, flat screen tv, sitting area (hello purple velvet sofa, very cool), comfy bed. Bathroom was by far the best we had in any hotel Europe, and we only stayed in 5 star hotels. One reviewer was angry about the view, but he was wrong. We would have had a view from the bathroom (but for the privacy screen), and then our bedroom/lving room was of a white wall. Which, after one night, was great, since the bathroom-facing view was really noisy! We just shut the bathroom door at night, and enjoyed the zen quiet of the white wall! We didn't have the hotel breakfast, since there are so many cafes within walking distance. We walked for hours every day, and enjoyed every minute of it. Ten minute walk to Rue Montagne for designer shopping, ten minute walk to Arc de Triomphe, 6 minute cab ride to Galeries Lafeyette, just a super location. Can't say enough about the hotel staff, they made it a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel, best bed, best service 5 star”
Reviews.Author: simone123094
Reviews.Content: We arrived hot and tired from a long day site seeing and dragging our bags behind us. The doorman was there to take all our heavy luggage and the reception staff were so helpful and on top of things. We were running late for a dinner booking and they helped by ringing the restaurant and getting exact directions and the best way to get there. This helped so much. I just wish we had spent more time at the hotel - best bed in Paris (so comfortable), awesome shower and spa and service. Its in a good area to get to the metro and the sites. Highly recommend it. 5 Star accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: honeymoon201006_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Champs Elysees Plaza for our honeymoon. We received top-notch personal pampering from the time we checked in until we checked out 5 days later. The hotel is not that big, therefore, we received a lot of personal attention. We had the Junior suite. The room was roomy and luxurious. The decor was old-world class meets modern chic. The bathroom was open and comfortable, with a stand alone bathtub and Hermes products. Housekeeping turned down the room twice a day. The concerige was the best part of the hotel. Stephen and co. took care of our every needs, with great personal attention and promptness. It was the boutique hotel experience that we hoped for and more. The Champs Elysees Plaza was hands down, the best hotel we've stayed in. It made a nice home away from home. Can't wait to return for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “High quality product in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: bmsocal
Reviews.Content: Booked a Junior Suite looking for something very comfortable with good access to the major sites of Paris. Staff was very helpful and friendly, everything in the hotel was of quality from the lobby to the room itself. Hotel was well situated 2 blocks from the Champs Elysees and an easy walk to the Arc de Triomphe. My room overlooked two streets and it would be fairly noisy in the mornings except for the well insulated windows King sized bed was very comfortable, furnishings first rate including a jacuzzi tub and a deluxe shower, two armchairs and a desk. Sony stero set to Jazz was a nice touch and a flat screen TV. Hermes shampoo, conditioner, etc was stocked in the room, everything exceptionally clean. Only downsides may have been a livelier bar and better kitchen hours but it is a small boutique hotel and that is the trade off for privacy and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Law135
Reviews.Content: There are two other reviews on this site, that say this is not a 5 star hotel and they are correct - it isn't. Infact one of the reception staff when we complained admitted that this was not a "5 star palace - with those services". So after writing this note I await the attack-like response from the management as seen on the other non-complimentary reviews. In Summary (for more detail read on) Small Boutique Hotel - not a 5 star hotel. Room Service Food - Terrible !! Courtyard Rooms - beware they face a very close-by white wall. Staff- Very Nice Service Attitude - Good until you complain ! Restaurant - What restaurant? We booked the hotel after checking out their website and reading these reviews. What we didn't pick up on, is this really is a boutique hotel and does not offer the service of a real 5 star hotel. We have stayed in some wonderful 5 star hotels around the world and this is not one. This was our honeymoon and we let the hotel know beforehand - we arrived late 9.30pm and were given our room key. Where to start...Let's start with the room... Yes it was reasonably large for a room but not for a Junior suite. The bathroom was lovely but the whirlpool bath was so uncomfortable with little jet bumps right across the back, bottom and sides - completely useless for relaxing. Hermes toiletries - v.nice we thought - but they were so highly perfumed and astringent that we both suffered minor issues. So if visiting and you have even the slightest care for your skin take your own milder toiletries. Having said that this is not the management fault... the toiletries are just very strong. Our room was quiet - very quiet almost not part of a big city. This is because it overlooked the courtyard. But not really - in fact our two tall lovely windows just faced a very high white wall. Our view of Paris from this 5 star hotel was a white wall !! All we needed were bars across the window to give it a true prison like view. So back to the courtyard. Our expectation of the courtyard is an area of land where one can sit. Nope, it is just a small area above a lower ground floor room surrounded by four walls - we are not even sure you can get out to it. The room was actually v.nicely appointed and very well furnished - but it was dark - the problem was it had dark furnishings and with windows facing the nearby white wall it just didn't get enough light. Our mistake was to wait too long to complain - so by the time we did and got offered a smaller room on the street side - we had lost the will to change. Our mistake. The bed was very large but not overly comfortable. There are some teabgs and a Nespresso coffee machine in the room but beware you will be charged 4 euros for each teabag used... and they are not even very nice teabags. If I was ordering room service for a lovely cup of tea - then yes I'd expect a charge but not for teabags in the room !! Cheap approach for a 5 star hotel more like a travelodge... And so to the room service... as I mentioned we arrived late... at 9.45pm phoned for the room service which was advertised up until 10.30pm... we were told that the chef had gone and that the limited menu was the only one available 5 or 6 dishes. We received the two huge plates of tasteless smoked salmon... very poor. 2 nights later after a long day of sight seeing, we thought we'd give the room service another go... mistake 2... tasteless and tiny... fish cassoulet and lamb curry - no flavour at all, as my wife rightly said this is France they are supposed to be able to cook aren't they, we ordered green beans but on delivery wer told they didn't have any and they had made other mixed vegetables.. what we got was a a tiny amount of lettuce. 5 star - non.. they asked us to call down to collect the tray.. when we did this they said - 'oh just leave it outside'... it was there all night... after some debate with the management we managed to get the two dishes credited. Not 5 star service.. I will at this point say the staff are mostly very friendly and I had a nice conversation with male cleaner about Paris. And even at the end of our stay the manager was very nice. But don't complain they just did not like it and are very defensive... they would do so much better to try harder to rectify a problem and not question guests ... they will gain far more loyalty. They did recommend an excellent restaurant for our final night. And so in summary as above... don't expect 5 star quality... expect a well serviced boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Champs Elysees Plaza lived up to it's excellent reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler16Fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Champs Elysees Plaza for 3 nights in May of 2010. The hotel was chic, comfortable, boutique-cozy and close to the Champs Elysees Blvd. The staff was incredibly accommodating. We flew into France from the states on an early morning flight. Unfortunately on the ride into the city, I became extremely car sick. Upon arriving at the Plaza, the staff went out of their way to make me comfortable, fussing over me as discreetly as possible, checked me into the first available room (at 10 am in the morning) and followed up afterwards to make sure I had recovered. The rooms were perfect - a haven from the busy Paris streets. Our room was facing an interior courtyard and was extremely quiet (loved that). The hotel also offered a tasty breakfast, great coffee machine in the room and a chic little bar off the lobby where we enjoyed champagne each night. I would high recommend this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaFeliz
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Paris to celebrate our daughters 16th birthday (my husband and 11yr old son) We surfed the internet to find a special hotel in the heart of Paris and did we land a gem! This charming 5 star hotel offered us everything. It was very personal and charming. The rooms where absolutely charming. The staff where fabulous, they even gave my daughter chocolates and card on her birthday. Any request for hairdressing app, taxi, tours... where met with 'of course' and they delivered. I could not recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: longhorn80
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Champs Elysee Plaza Hotel for 6 nights on a Spring Break trip to celebrate her upcoming University graduation in May. We stayed at several hotels in other cities on this trip. By far, this lovely hotel was the best. We arrived late and were graciously welcomed and shown our perfect Junior Suite. Everything about the hotel was 5 star. The staff was extremely helpful and enjoyable any time we needed them. The morning breakfast was wonderful and had many items to choose from for every taste. What a perfect way to begin a busy day in Paris! From start to finish this was an exceptional experience. Thank you Champs Elysee Plaza staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: anithasthlm
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with great location just a block from the fantastic Champs Elyseés. This was the first time for me and my family in Paris and I must say that we had a wonderful time and that we felt like royalties at this hotel. As "first-timers" in Paris we felt a bit lost in this big city but the hotelstaff assisted us with maps and recommendations about things to do and see when you are in Paris. I can strongly recommend this hotel!! By the way, the french breakfast is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - the website is misleading, rooms small and fireplaces are sham”
Reviews.Author: Baywolff
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to an upscale experience for the honeymoon we never got to take and booked this hotel based on the website the reviews on tripadvisor. Unfortunately neither were accurate. The price for what you get is just not worth it. I live in San Francisco, so I know expensive and quality, this hotel is just expensive. We booked a junior suite, which we were told would have a fireplace and corner windows with views - none of this true. When we asked for another room, it was no better. When I saw a room that looked like the one on the website, they wanted to charge me another 300 Euro/ night on top of the $700/ night price! When we told them we were not happy and asked could we just get our money back (we paid in full at booking) we were told no, even though they said they were fully booked and could not find us a better room for several days. Please do not stay at this over priced and misleading establishment that is not interested in making you happy.

Reviews.Title: “To experience a Parisiene delight this hotel is a must when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: zorantrifu
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Champs Elysees Plaza Hotel was one that we will not forget for get for a long time. The experience was totally unexpected buy the warm hospitality and charm that this boutique hotel has to offer. The staff and management were very helpfull and always looking at ways to please us. My special thanks goes to the Hotel management and staff for making our stay in Paris most memorable. Thank you Mr & Mrs Trifunovic (Australia)

Reviews.Title: “feels,looks and is romantic like paris”
Reviews.Author: lingre
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have stayed in this boutique hotel and its just simply beautiful! not only is the hotel situated just off the champs elysee, it has a gorgeous bar, the concierge is fantastic, the rooms are just superbly decorated and are absolutely immaculate. if i were to open a magazine with a hotel of paris-this is what it would look like. we stayed in the junior suite both times, but had a friend this time who stayed in a standard room which was more than ample even for two people. its a little on the pricey side but worth every cent. there is a starbucks 3 doors down and a 3 minute stroll to the heart of the champs elysee. there are complimentary hermes toiletries in the rooms which each time i know smell remind me of this lovely hotel and our stays there. would not hesitate to recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue for romantic break.”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in hotels higher up the pecking order in Paris that have been average I am astonished at the lowly placing of this lovely place. We booked via Expedia and at the time got a deal significantly lower than the rack rate so it was doubly good. If you get a similar offer this really is an excellent option for a romantic, luxury break in Paris. It is not on the Left Bank but taxis were so easy and cheap so we could be there in 10 minutes. On the upside however we had the Champs Elysees on our doorstep. Concierge dining recommendations were spot on. The hotel has a fabulous major city feel with simply splendid rooms – high ceilings, fire places, comfortable seating areas and ours had a majorly wonderful bathroom. Hermes toiletries were generously supplied. Misses five star as the bar was not manned a lot of the time and restaurant didn’t really exist except to offer room service fare. BUT the meat platter was fantastic and a very good option for two if you are looking for a light lunch or dinner. Other downfall was a very, very restricted wine list (and even then they still did not have our choices) so we drank some rather poor wine here - surely unforgivable in France. Suggest however you buy your own and ask for a bucket of ice.

Reviews.Title: “superb stay with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: dogbutt0
Reviews.Content: having just returned from our 4 day honeymoon at this hotel booked mainly on its excellent reviews on this site,and how delighted we did as we had a fantastic time from the minute we arrived to the moment we left.it is a small boutique hotel just off the main road where most of the attractions are based so the location is ideal,it has a small bar area and breakfast room which is perfectly adequate,a few reviews have commented on the bar being a little pricey well we didnt find anywhere that wasnt so if your going to pay 15 quid for a g and t may as well have it in luxury lol.the rooms were lovely very spacious modern decor,big comfy bed and a juliet balcony overlooking the street,large bathrooms with a double shower and a jacuzzi bath big enough for 2 with nobody laying on the taps or sitting on the plug great result.theres also a spa and fitness room downstairs that we didnt use but looked very nice,the hotel was superb in every way but what made it that extra special was the staff,from the chambermaids to the porters so friendly and genuine,a special mention though to stephane and emmanuelle on reception,they were without doubt the best ive encountered on any hotel anywhere,nothing was too much trouble for them restaurant advice,shows to see,where to go,even went to the trouble to print maps off and mark places of interest for us,having taken there advice on a restaurant they did show genuine concern the following morning has to if we had enjoyed it and its a credit to the hotel that they have two superb people on hand,its a superb hotel and i guarantee you will have a great stay,i picked a great city the best hotel and best lady to be my wife,love you vik xxx

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious boutique hotel - excellent”
Reviews.Author: Menka
Reviews.Content: As part of our honeymoon we spent three nights at this hotel and loved it. Our room (72) had a wonderful view over Paris with Mont Martre visible from one window and the Eiffel Tower from another. Jacuzzi bath, separate shower, tasteful decor. Important to check and re-check and then confirm that the quoted internet price is indeed the whole price that you pay on check-out! We were quoted one price on the net and another by phone, this was cleared up without a scene and for that we are grateful. Excellent location, almost no street noise (very rare in Paris hotels), the Indian restaurant opposite is arguably the best in France. Hotel took care of parking and keeping eyes on our car. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was more than adequate but why charge 8Euros for a couple of fried eggs on top of the standard breakfast charge? Internet wi-fi was also included in the room price and worked fine. All in all we had an excellent stay and will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: alvas02
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent weekend with my wife in Paris. We booked the welness package which inlcuded a Deluxe Suite (in our case no 54, corner suite), late check-in/out, breakfast and 2 1h massage sessions through the hotel website. The hotel exceeded our high expectations in terms of room size and elegance, location, personal and friendly service. Breakfast was quite good, massage service excellent. Did not use the wellness facilites. Staff was friendly and responded to two minor mishaps with speed and efficiency (a mix up of the actual room booked for us and a temporary issue with the heating). There were eager to book restaurants and offer advice wherever they could. The room we booked was around 65m2 in size and probably on of the best rooms in the hotel. Furniture and decor is of high quality and the jacuzzi in the bath actually fits two. Hermes amenities are a nice touch. Only downside was the expensive but well stoked mini bar (which we didn't use). Breakfast area is charming and the actual breakfast has many choices including a very good French cheese platter. Only comment is that at the price charged, omelletes and salmon should be included. Overall, a great boutique hotel with a friendly atmosphere with classical charm and luxury. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a Eurostar package, which worked out excellent value. The room we had was huge, so there was plenty of space for the sofa bed for our teenage daughter. The bathroom has a wonderful bath, and being on the sixth floor, we could just about see the Eiffel Tower from the bathroom window. Wonderful ! The service was very attentive and friendly, and made the stay even better. Initially we were shown to a room which did not have an extra bed, but this was rectified very quickly without fuss. The only drawback to our stay were the prices in Paris. The hotel charges £18 for a gin and tonic at the bar - eyewatering ! Although the prices in Paris at present do generally take your breath away with the poor exchange rate. We booked an excursion on the same Eurostar package, which was an hour and a half coach tour, a river tour, and then lunch in the Eiffel Tower restaurant. Again very good value when booked in advance, and no need to queue at the Eiffel Tower which saves an hour or so. The lunch was more like a canteen than a restuarant, but a worthwhile experience. We had an evening meal at the Renault showroom on the Champs Elysees. A quirky experience for any car lovers amoungst you. The showroom is just 10 minutes walk from the hotel, so no need for taxis. Service was not great, but theres plenty of people watching to do, so not a particular problem. A great short break.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tal76
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a regular room, which was relatively very big for a parisian hotel. The room was very clean and designed with a lot of tastfull. We very enjoyed from the big jacuzy bath, the uniqe shower, the Hermes products, the cosy bath robes and the Gudiva perlins! The service was AMAZING !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atbrc2001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our first trip to Paris this past fall. We wanted to see Paris, but really just wanted to "get away". This hotel was an excellent choice! Nearly everyone speaks English (which helps), it is steps away from the Champs Elysees a fast street, but is nestled in a fairly quiet neighborhood. The rooms are large by European standards. The bathroom was spacious, clean and had the best bathtub I have seen in any hotel. Our room had two balconettes. We left the windows open all day and night to feel the cool air and absorb the atmosphere. A little pricey, but WELL worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gswjapan
Reviews.Content: After much research including trip advisor I booked my wife and I for 3 nights at the Champs Elysee Plaza Hotel and i am extremely happy with my decision. We booked a junior suite which i highly recommend as it had a huge bathroom with a great shower and a claw tub bath - king size (or can make 2 twins) bed and large sitting area and 12 foot high ceilings. Very spacious by any standards let alone Paris. Very chic and stylish decor with great in room amenities. Staff was very friendly (except for 1 lady who had a bit of an attitude) and everyone spoke good english and was very helpful. Did not eat breakfast as there was a Starbucks close by which saved me 20 Euro per person. The location is fairly convenient as it is close to several Metro's although I would not say the immediate area around the hotel had a lot of charm although you can quickly walk to other neighborhoods with lots of restaurants and shopping. This is a boutique hotel so if you are looking for all the amenities of a large hotel (fitness center, restaurants, etc) then this may not be for you. It does have limited room service and a nice lounge (although drinks are very pricey). Overall it was an outstanding stay/.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, friendly staff. Impeccable hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkie32
Reviews.Content: All staff speak fairly good english and there is nothing they wouldn't do for the guests, so just ask!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms & location”
Reviews.Author: Mazza28Hants
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late on Friday night and there was some confusion over the booking - they had the sat & sunday booked by mistake, but the hotel staff were very patient and sorted the booking out and even upgraded us to a massive room on the top floor after the confusion - you could even see the Eiffel Tower from the window! The room was gorgeous and very big, with a massive bathroom - large jacuzzi bath and a shower. The bed was also huge and very comfortable. We had breakfast both mornings in the hotel which was really good with lots to choose from. The location is brilliant for sighseeing and wondering around central paris. We got the metro to the hotel from Gare du Nord and then didnt need to use it again as everything is within walking distance. Overall, I would recomend the hotel for the great location, helpful staff, clean and lovely rooms. Would definitely come back if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms in pricey central Paris”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel this past week for 7 days along with my family. On a quiet street, the rooms were suprisingly large for Paris. I have yet to see such large rooms at any downtown hotel in Paris possibly with the exception of the Four Seasons. The bathrooms ares spotless and clean. The Lobby is small and functional, but polite staff and free wi-fi access, makes this an excellent place to stay if you are looking for sensible accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Opulence”
Reviews.Author: gasman
Reviews.Content: Well located about 800m off the Champs Elysses. Palatial sized rooms with similarly proportioned bathrooms, both scrupulously clean with a wonderfully comfortable bed. The hotel breakfast was easily the best I've ever had, and I've had hundreds. We paid 310 Euro per night which included breakfast - given the location and quality of this hotel, I thought this was a reasonable deal. The only thing that left a bad taste was being confronted with a bill for 30 Euros for two drinks (gin & tonic) we had in the hotel bar. Okay, I didn't check when purchasing; but this really did feel like a monumental rip off, and was the only black mark against what was otherwise a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, charming & pricey”
Reviews.Author: SE-Explorer
Reviews.Content: We did get a relatively good deal on this for 290 euros + tax/night and it is very convenient being 2 blocks off the Champs Elysees & the George V stop on the Metro, in the shadow of the Arc de Triomphe. Requested and received a quiet room facing the central atrium. Great assistance from the front desk whenever we asked: making reservations, giving directions to food market, calling taxi. We skipped the expensive (26 euros per person) breakfast in the hotel. The coffee machine in the room is NOT free - they tried to charge me 20 euros for one sachet of "espresso"! I saw a few hidden in a cabinet. Maybe that's why they thought I had used them - but really, even 4 * hotels which put coffee machines in the room don't have the gall to then charge for coffee in a $300/nt room! Nevertheless, great French feel,large firm bed, large bathroom with separate shower & whirlpool, good desk for working, good climate control (we like it cool in the room & AC worked well) and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWanderlust
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights here based on the reviews we read on this site. All of our expectations were met with this hotel. The front desk was very helpful, the rooms were tastefully decorated, and the location was excellent. The hotel was quiet (great for sleeping) and a short walk away to the bustle of the Champs Elysees! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusanJToronto
Reviews.Content: My 17-year old daughter and I stayed here in this very lovely hotel for 8 nights. We wanted a room big enough that we wouldn't feel cramped (we took lots of clothes), and the junior suite was perfect. The room was charmingly decorated, clean, and very quiet. The bathroom was spectacular, and the jacuzzi tub was relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. Loved the separate shower, and appreciated the Hermes toiletries. The staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. Don't know what we would have done without their advice and assistance. My daughter had no trouble setting up the internet in our room, although there was a small charge for this service. Because I was travelling with my daughter, I was quite concerned about our security and safety. We felt completely secure. Great location, a short walk to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “lovely return visit”
Reviews.Author: visitorLeics
Reviews.Content: I booked this holiday for me and my husband, his sister and her husband and his brother and partner. I booked the hotel after the reviews on Tripadvisor taking into account location, cost and opinions of previous travellers to the hotel. We travelled out on the Eurostar and all went very smoothly. The hotel is in a great location a couple of minutes from the Champs Elysees the Arc de Triomphe end. Two rooms were ready out of the three when we arrived. I had booked junior suites. Two were on the second floor and one on the 6th. Room 24 is the most airy and light although the couple staying in that room said that it was noisy at night. We stayed on the 6th floor. The bed was a good size, the jacuzzi bath fantastic, the view was however disappointing - a wall. All the rooms were nicely decorated and a good size. All staff were extremely welcoming, unobtrusive and efficient. Breakfast was adequate especially if you arrived by nine otherwise things did run out and there was a wait (this did not apply to us). I would not recommend the hotel if you want a hotel restaurant and no one seemed to use the bar. However, there are so many restaurants, bistros and brasseries around that it would seem a shame to stay at the hotel. There is an English pub on the opposite side of the road to the hotel and about a one minute walk away if you like that kind of thing. The previous year we had stayed at Hotel Tremoille, I preferred that location on the other side of the Champs Elysees and its rooms were similar in size. The area around Tremoille also has a great selection of French bistros and indeed we ate at two restaurants we had eaten at previously. Chez Andre was bustling in the evening and you must book at weekends. We ate at another bistro around the same area at lunch time (can't remember the name though) and the restaurant manager remembered us from the year before. We revisited the Latin Quarter after a 24 year gap and ate in an extremely busy restaurant serving typical french bistro food. Paris is expensive this time round because of the exchange rate and a pint of beer seemed to range from £7 to £28 per pint! The Champs is ideal if you want an understated , comfortable,boutique style hotel. If you have the cash the George V still can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, but”
Reviews.Author: Hirondelle24
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 4 nights in this hotel, in a junior suite at about 400 euros a night. The location is great, its quiet and at the same time very close to the Champs-Élysées, shops and restaurants. Its a quiet road. There are some things we didn't like: - internet was in the lounge of the hotel and you had to pay for it. It wasn't clear what to do and how to do it, nobody of the staff assisted so we went to an 'espace internet'. - nespresso maker in the room, they even advertise with it, but the cups and also teabags (!) are charged 2 euros a piece. This is not communicated, so you'll find this out afterwards. The machine didnt work properly so we ended up with luke warm coffee. - Equipment in the room was poor and we have slept in rooms that were better cleaned during our stay. Double room was equiped for 1 person (like wine glass etc), like it wasnt communicated that there were 2 guests (although there were two beds). What we loved was the room itself. Wonderful, large, high ceilings, flatscreen, beautiful decorated, bathroom stunning with massage bath. We would highly recommend the hotel for a romantic weekend and if you want to impress their girlfriend. We didnt want to leave the room, it was very comfortable. Its a pity this hotel isnt managed better, we did t like the "cheap" attitude, felt like being ripped off for a couple of euros, not something you would expect from a 4 star hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaolaVicenza
Reviews.Content: Great position, beautiful and clean room, lovely hermes toiletries. Friendly and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Timfromsussex
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from Tripadvisor reviews. Thanks! We booked the suite - room 54. Fantastic room - large with beautiful proportions. Lovely hermes toiletries. Friendly smiley staff - all of whom spoke excellent English. Nice bar for a drink before dinner. Highly recommend this hotel for an intimate private getaway. If you want pool / spa go elsewhere as this is very much a boutique hotel. All rooms are big - I booked suite because my wife is unwell and we tend to have to take things easy. Therefore useful to have extra space. If this was not the case the standard rooms are an excellent size.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brigad00n
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September and were totally delighted with the quality and service at this hotel. We only booked a normal double room and were surprised how big it was, and the quality of the furnishings etc. was way above average. Would definitely stay here again and would have no problem in recommending this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality boutique hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: NoneNixNada
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Champs Elysees Plaza Hotel several times while in Paris on business, and each time it has been a pleasure. Perhaps the best example of the quality of the hotel was a night I arrived after a long day of meetings and a late flight from Frankfurt, only to find that an incompetent coordinator I had working for me at the time had cancelled my reservation by mistake. It was 1 a.m. and I had nowhere to go. The gentleman at the front desk that night was exceptionally helpful and indicated that as the company I work for used the hotel regularly, there was no problem, and he had me in a room in 5 minutes at our corporate rate. I hazard to guess what would have happened if there were no available rooms, but I'm sure he would have found me something. Combine this with the lovely aesthetics of the hotel and the great location and I can highly recommend the Champs Elysees Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish and Great service!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly57
Reviews.Content: Fantastic choice, if you like stylish hotels and has privacy. 2 mins walk from the best avenue in the world ( Champs Elysees) The Plaza has very stylish rooms and excellent service! The staff is professional and always ready to help! I come here every year for 3 weeks and I always recommend it to my family or friends. Go for it, you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Kate01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our 10 year wedding anniversary and it was brilliant. We are pretty fussy people so this is saying something. The room was gorgeous, very stylish, very quiet and a lovely warm feeling to it. The bathroom was great, huge spa bath and hermes products. The service was perfect, friendly and helpful. We had room service and a lovely relaxed breakfast in the restaurant and both faultless. The location was spot-on as well, 5 minute walk to metro and arc de triomphe. If you want to stay somewhere special that ticks all the boxes for a perfect weekend in Paris then definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: sushi33
Reviews.Content: Great small boutique hotel !! Located on rue de Berri, a very quiet street off the Champs. Superior room, large, very nicely decorated, and well equiped (LCD, hifi, and with personal Nespresso coffe machine). Internet Wifi is available and free of charge. Large Bathroom large with jacuzzi and separate shower. Did not try breakfast, as Starbuck, 10 meters from hotel. Made booking directly with hotel, and got cheap rate, which was not available on the hotel website, and as well not available on the traditional "Hotel discount" websites. Overall, very good experience (except lift, which is really very very small, but charming !!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - stylish - WOW!”
Reviews.Author: MegW
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at this fantastic hotel. The room was massive, very stylish, comfortable bed. Great seating area. Fabulous shower and jacuzzi bath. Hermes toiletries, bath robes, slippers and soft fluffy towels. All the public areas were decorated/furnished to an extremely high standard and the staff were very helpful and friendly I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough and I was gutted only to stay one night

Reviews.Title: “A Real Winner”
Reviews.Author: JAG27
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 day break and this hotel was lovely in every respect. We arrived at 11am and it was confirmed we would get our room at 3pm.We only waited 20 mins to be told our room was ready.The room was lovely,beautifully decorated in grey stripe wallpaper and gorgeous plum full length curtains.When we entered the room we were greeted with the sound of music playing and a lovely aroma.It had a queen size bed which had lovely bed linen and bedspreads.The bathroom was a good size too with a huge jacuzzi type bath.Nice size bath towels,slippers and towelling robe.The staff were very efficient and friendly and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.It is a 5 min walk to the Champs Elysee and a superb postion,surrounded by shops,cafes and restaurants.The Chinese restaurant in the same street was excellent and went to Starbucks a couple of times because breakfast is not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the 11th of August with my husband. Hotel was easy to find and valet service took care of parking the car. This is a major benefit if you are a typical North American driver who decides to drive in Paris (which I would not recommend unless you have a Navigation System). The hotel is located very close to the Champ des Elysees (maybe a 3 minute walk) with its outdoor patio's and shopping. Staff at the front desk were very friendly and our room was beautiful: Very comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, desk, a sitting area and large bathroom with jaccuzi tub and separate shower. There was a personalized welcome card and a fresh rose waiting for us in the room - this is something little, but appreciated. We didn't eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the food. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay - the hotel is great and we'd stay there again. That being said, last night we stayed in the Latin Quarter for 60% less than what we paid to stay here. The hotel was not as nice, but location was great all the same. Just food for thought in case you are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Champs Elysees Plaza”
Reviews.Author: girltraveller75
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel on a couple of occasions when travelling on my own. Location is great, rooms are pretty large and bathrooms are excellent with jacuzzi baths and separate walk in showers. Always have a good night's sleep here in comfortable beds. Would recommend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: point579
Reviews.Content: Champs Elysees Plaza is at a great location, right off the Champs Elysees. Rooms are bigger than what you expect at a prime location in Europe. The staff is very friendly and they have a nice breakfast. The only trouble I had was that one of the airconditioners in my room did not work on my last night in the hotel. They did not have anyone around to fix it but provided me with a portable fan for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: NNMESQ
Reviews.Content: We booked directly with the hotel via email and received a terrific package (mona lisa). Stayed in a large suite (huge by european standards), with a fireplace, a luxurious bathroom with a jacuzzi and many other amenities. The bedding was clean, fresh and comfortable. Had the choice of having an adequate continental breakfast (included in our package), served in our room or downstairs in the modest area in the lounge. The staff was extremelely cordial, helpful and professional. From the moment of our arrival, our needs were catered to, with hospitality and formality. All spoke english perfectly and were happy to do so if that was your choice. The location is excellent if you choose to stay on the right bank. It is right off the Champs Elysees, in a small discreet street providing quiet from the busy larger boulevard. It is about 30 minutes to the Louvre by foot, but a few blocks away from the metro. Discretion is the most noteworthy characteristic about this hotel. The rooms are removed from the common areas and from each other, providing a solitude and tranquility that is appreciated after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping. I recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a modest front entrance and small communal lounge along side a small breakfast room. The staff are polite and yet functional with their discourse. The hotel was mostly quiet and clean although we could hear the shower from the room next door. We could also hear some heavy footsteps from the room upstairs which we later found out was probably children running about. Although a little annoying it did not detract from the overall experience of the stay. Although the room was not what we booked with Lastminute (we booked a Superior but were not allocated a superior). This was something we unfortunately did not realise until we were checking out and my wife and I started quizing the hotel reception. Having said that, the room we were allocated was clean, well decorated and a good size despite being the smallest room in the hotel (as we were also told on departure). Highly recommended but be careful who you book with and ask lots of questions when you arrive to make sure you are getting the room you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Champs Elysees Plaza for 3 nights in March. We had 2 Junior Suites. It's a really great hotel, we had a wonderful stay. The rooms were very large (Huge by Paris Standards) and well appointed. Excellent King-size bed, large couch, coffee table, desk, breakfast table, stereo system. The room was also very quiet, since the hotel is situated on a side street. On arrival there were fresh roses in the room with a box of Godiva chocolates. Each evening housekeeping left fresh chocolates in the room. My bathroom was large - It had a large Jacuzzi and a seperate walk-in shower with waterfall shower-head. Each day the bathroom was stocked with Hermes bath products. Breakfast was brought to the room every morning , exactly on time - Each day by a different person, but always with a very friendly attitude. This was typical of all the staff, always smiling, helping with directions & suggestions on where to go out and where to eat. Some reviewers have mentioned the elevator - Yes, it's small - tiny in fact ; but it's very quiet :) There wasn't a single negative thing to taint our stay at this hotel. I would stay there again when I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel - made our trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - the service was fantastic, the rooms authentic and the location was perfect. We booked on a last minute site and had a problem with our reservation when we arrived - the hotel did not have a record of our booking. However the staff could not have been more accommodating - free breakfast, champagne, an alternate room and some of the best service we received in Europe. Our room on the 6th floor was perfectly suitable - from one window we could see the Eiffel Tower, from the other we could see Sacre Coeur. A quick step up to the Champs Elysees, comfy bed, enormous claw-foot bath all made this a haven for us in Paris. Would definitely recommend, and would absolutely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Champs Elysees Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 35 rue de Berri | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
